items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect held without bail
items.standfirst: The man accused of killing conservative commentator and activist Charlie Kirk is being held without bail in a Utah jail. Meanwhile, vigils and memorials across the country honored Kirk as his widow made her first public remarks since his death.
items.content: The man accused of killing conservative commentator and activist Charlie Kirk is being held without bail in a Utah jail. Meanwhile, vigils and memorials across the country honored Kirk as his widow made her first public remarks since his death.

FBI Director Kash Patel is facing scrutiny regarding the investigation of the shooting.

clusters.title: Bottles thrown at police as 100 officers clash with ‘unite the kingdom’ marchers – UK politics live
clusters.neutral_headline: Far-Right Rally in London Leads to Clashes

items.title: Bottles thrown at police as 100 officers clash with ‘unite the kingdom’ marchers – UK politics live
items.standfirst: Met police estimate 110,000 people attended rally, with smaller number of counter-protesters ‘penned in’More than a hundred people have gathered outside Russell Square before the ‘march against fascism’ counter-protest against the ‘unite the kingdom’ march, featuring far-right activist Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon. Both are being held in central London on Saturday.According to the PA news agency, people in Russell Square milled around with placards that said “refugees welcome” and “oppose Tommy Robinson”. Chants of “say it loud, say it clear, refugees are welcome here” started at about 11.20am, the news agency reports.The far right are a menace to the whole of society. Their first targets, asylum seekers and Muslims, are broadening to all migrants, black people and on to trade unionists, all religious minorities and anti-racists.This is going to be big, but we are also talking about movement to the right of Reform UK and we still don’t know where it is going. Continue reading...
items.content: Met police estimate 110,000 people attended rally, with smaller number of counter-protesters ‘penned in’More than a hundred people have gathered outside Russell Square before the ‘march against fascism’ counter-protest against the ‘unite the kingdom’ march, featuring far-right activist Tommy Robinson, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon. Both are being held in central London on Saturday.According to the PA news agency, people in Russell Square milled around with placards that said “refugees welcome” and “oppose Tommy Robinson”. Chants of “say it loud, say it clear, refugees are welcome here” started at about 11.20am, the news agency reports.The far right are a menace to the whole of society. Their first targets, asylum seekers and Muslims, are broadening to all migrants, black people and on to trade unionists, all religious minorities and anti-racists.This is going to be big, but we are also talking about movement to the right of Reform UK and we still don’t know where it is going. Continue reading...

items.title: Police assaulted as far-right rally led by Tommy Robinson sparks clashes
items.standfirst: More than 110,000 people join Tommy Robinson-organised protest featuring racist conspiracy theories and hate speechUK politics live – latest updatesMore than 110,000 people have taken part in a far-right street protest organised by the activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson, in what is thought to be the largest nationalist event in decades.Marchers travelled to London by train and coach for a demonstration, which was billed as a “festival of free speech”, but by its conclusion had amplified racist conspiracy theories and anti-Muslim hate speech across Whitehall. Continue reading...

items.content: Tens of thousands of people are expected to descend on Britain’s capital on Saturday for the largest far-right rally in decades, organized by anti-immigration activist Tommy Robinson.

ai_summary: Over 100,000 people attended a rally led by Tommy Robinson in London.
Counter-protesters clashed with police during the "Unite the Kingdom" march.
The rally featured far-right activist Tommy Robinson, also known as Stephen Yaxley-Lennon.
Some protesters carried signs opposing Tommy Robinson and supporting refugees.
Police were assaulted during the far-right rally, leading to clashes.

items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday urged all NATO countries to stop buying oil from Russia and impose their own tariffs of 50 to 100 percent on China until the end of the Ukraine war. NATO members Turkey, Hungary and Slovakia all continue to purchase oil from Russia.

items.title: Nepal sets March elections after naming interim prime minister
items.standfirst: Nepal's former chief justice Sushila Karki was sworn in Friday as the country's prime minister to lead a six-month transition to elections, after deadly anti-corruption protests ousted the government. The previous prime minister quit Tuesday as parliament was set ablaze.
items.content: Nepal's former chief justice Sushila Karki was sworn in Friday as the country's prime minister to lead a six-month transition to elections, after deadly anti-corruption protests ousted the government. The previous prime minister quit Tuesday as parliament was set ablaze.

items.title: Nepal appoints its first female PM after historic week of deadly protests
items.standfirst: Former chief justice Sushila Karki, who was nominated by gen Z representatives, to lead interim governmentNepal has sworn in its first female prime minister after a historic week in which widespread youth protests forced the resigniation of her predecessor and the dissolving of parliament.Sushila Karki, the former chief justice of Nepal, took the oath of office late on Friday, after several tense days of negotiation. Karki will lead an interim government until fresh elections take place in March next year. Continue reading...
items.content: Former chief justice Sushila Karki, who was nominated by gen Z representatives, to lead interim governmentNepal has sworn in its first female prime minister after a historic week in which widespread youth protests forced the resigniation of her predecessor and the dissolving of parliament.Sushila Karki, the former chief justice of Nepal, took the oath of office late on Friday, after several tense days of negotiation. Karki will lead an interim government until fresh elections take place in March next year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Nepal appointed Sushila Karki as interim Prime Minister after deadly protests.
The House of Representatives was dissolved following anti-corruption protests.
Nepal's new prime minister faces challenges in her role.
Elections are scheduled for March 5, and restrictions have been eased.
The appointment followed a week of deadly protests that ousted the government.

clusters.title: Rubio calls Russian drones over Poland 'unacceptable' but declines to say it was intentional
clusters.neutral_headline: NATO Bolsters Eastern Flank After Drone Incursion

items.title: Rubio calls Russian drones over Poland 'unacceptable' but declines to say it was intentional
items.standfirst: Nato announces plans to beef up defense as Poland rejects Trump’s suggestion drones were sent by mistakeThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, on Saturday said the incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace this week was unacceptable but that it remained unclear whether Russia had deliberately sent the drones into Polish territory. Nato announced plans to beef up the defense of Europe’s eastern flank on Friday, after Poland shot down the drones that had violated its airspace, the first known shots fired by a member of the western alliance during Russia’s war in Ukraine.“We think it’s an unacceptable and unfortunate and dangerous development,” Rubio told reporters before departing on a trip to Israel and Britain. Continue reading...
items.content: Nato announces plans to beef up defense as Poland rejects Trump’s suggestion drones were sent by mistakeThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, on Saturday said the incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace this week was unacceptable but that it remained unclear whether Russia had deliberately sent the drones into Polish territory. Nato announced plans to beef up the defense of Europe’s eastern flank on Friday, after Poland shot down the drones that had violated its airspace, the first known shots fired by a member of the western alliance during Russia’s war in Ukraine.“We think it’s an unacceptable and unfortunate and dangerous development,” Rubio told reporters before departing on a trip to Israel and Britain. Continue reading...

items.title: NATO bulks up defences on eastern flank after Russian drone incursion
items.standfirst: NATO said Friday it's bulking up its defensive posture on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia and Ukraine with new equipment to deter potential Russian aggression following an incursion by Russian drones into Polish territory. The alliance's supreme commander in Europe said a new operation, dubbed Eastern Sentry, will add equipment from France, Denmark, Germany and the UK to its existing air and ground-based defenses.
items.content: NATO said Friday it's bulking up its defensive posture on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia and Ukraine with new equipment to deter potential Russian aggression following an incursion by Russian drones into Polish territory. The alliance's supreme commander in Europe said a new operation, dubbed Eastern Sentry, will add equipment from France, Denmark, Germany and the UK to its existing air and ground-based defenses.

items.title: New Nato mission to bolster eastern flank after Russia drone incursion
items.standfirst: France, Denmark and Germany will send jets to Poland after Russian drones flew into its airspace.
items.content: France, Denmark and Germany will send jets to Poland after Russian drones flew into its airspace.

items.title: UK joins NATO operation to bolster Europe's eastern flank
items.standfirst: NATO is to bolster Europe's eastern flank, including the use of UK military resources, after Russia's "reckless and unacceptable" violation of Polish airspace.
items.content: NATO is to bolster Europe's eastern flank, including the use of UK military resources, after Russia's "reckless and unacceptable" violation of Polish airspace.

ai_summary: Marco Rubio called Russian drones over Poland "unacceptable" but unclear if intentional.
NATO is increasing its defense on its eastern flank bordering Belarus, Russia, and Ukraine.
A new NATO operation, "Eastern Sentry," will add equipment to existing defenses.
France, Denmark, and Germany will send jets to Poland.
The UK is joining the NATO operation to bolster Europe's eastern flank.

items.title: U.N. assembly votes for two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
items.standfirst: The United States, Israel's closest ally, reiterated its opposition to the New York Declaration and the General Assembly resolution endorsing implementation of a two-state solution.
items.content: The United States, Israel's closest ally, reiterated its opposition to the New York Declaration and the General Assembly resolution endorsing implementation of a two-state solution.

items.title: 'No Palestinian State, This Place Is Ours': Netanyahu Rejects UN Two State Recognition
items.standfirst: 'No Palestinian State, This Place Is Ours': Netanyahu Rejects UN Two State Recognition Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has firmly rejected the idea of Palestinian statehood at a moment it is being pushed in the UN General Assembly, declaring, "There will be no Palestinian state - this…
items.content: 'No Palestinian State, This Place Is Ours': Netanyahu Rejects UN Two State Recognition Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has firmly rejected the idea of Palestinian statehood at a moment it is being pushed in the UN General Assembly, declaring, "There will be no Palestinian state - this…

items.title: UN assembly votes to back two-state solution to Israel-Palestinian conflict
items.standfirst: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a nonbinding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. The vote was 142-10 with 12 abstentions.
items.content: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a nonbinding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. The vote was 142-10 with 12 abstentions.

items.title: UN assembly votes to back two-state solution for Israel and Palestine
items.standfirst: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a non-binding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. FRANCE 24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier brings us more.
items.content: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Friday to support a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and urge Israel to commit to a Palestinian state, which Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vehemently opposes. The 193-member world body approved a non-binding resolution endorsing the “New York Declaration," which sets out a phased plan to end the nearly 80-year conflict. FRANCE 24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier brings us more.

ai_summary: The UN General Assembly voted to support a two-state solution.
The United States reiterated its opposition to the resolution.
The resolution urges Israel to commit to a Palestinian state.
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu opposes the two-state solution.
The vote was 142-10 with 12 abstentions.

items.title: Israel ramps up strikes on Gaza City, killing at least 32 people, according to hospital
items.standfirst: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel ramps up its offensive there and urges Palestinians to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday.
items.content: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel ramps up its offensive there and urges Palestinians to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday.

items.title: At least 32 people killed as Israel intensifies airstrikes in Gaza City, medical staff say
items.standfirst: A barrage of airstrikes has killed at least 32 people in Gaza City as Israel continued intensifying its offensive there, medical staff have said.
items.content: A barrage of airstrikes has killed at least 32 people in Gaza City as Israel continued intensifying its offensive there, medical staff have said.

items.title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens amid expanding offensive in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City amid Israel's expanding offensive. While Gazans are urged to evacuate, many say they don't know where to go as there are no safe zones in the enclave.
items.content: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City amid Israel's expanding offensive. While Gazans are urged to evacuate, many say they don't know where to go as there are no safe zones in the enclave.

items.title: IDF cautions Netanyahu over Gaza invasion as airstrikes kill dozens
items.standfirst: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel escalated its military campaign and urged residents to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday. Meanwhile, the IDF issued their strongest warning yet to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, cautioning that a ground assault on Gaza City could result in the deaths of Israeli hostages, FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.
items.content: A barrage of airstrikes killed at least 32 people across Gaza City as Israel escalated its military campaign and urged residents to evacuate, medical staff reported Saturday. Meanwhile, the IDF issued their strongest warning yet to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, cautioning that a ground assault on Gaza City could result in the deaths of Israeli hostages, FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky said, reporting from Jerusalem.

ai_summary: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 32 people in Gaza City.
Israel is intensifying its offensive in Gaza.
Gazans are urged to evacuate, but many have nowhere to go.
The IDF cautioned Netanyahu about a ground assault on Gaza City.
Medical staff reported the casualties from the airstrikes.

items.title: Fed's Cook claimed second residence as 'vacation home,' undercutting Trump fraud claims
items.standfirst: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.
items.content: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook referred to a condo she bought in 2021 as a "vacation home" in a loan estimate, which could undermine claims by the Trump administration that she committed mortgage fraud.(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)

items.title: Fed governor Lisa Cook declared key property as ‘vacation home’, files show
items.standfirst: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...
items.content: Document appears to undermine claim from Donald Trump allies that Cook committed mortgage fraudA loan estimate for an Atlanta home purchased by Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor accused of mortgage fraud by the Trump administration, shows that Cook had declared the property as a “vacation home”, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.The document, dated 28 May 2021, was issued to Cook by her credit union in the weeks before she completed the purchase and shows that she had told the lender that the Atlanta property would not be her primary residence. The document appears to counter other documentation that Cook’s critics have cited in support of their claims that she committed mortgage fraud by reporting two different homes as her primary residence, two independent real-estate experts said. Continue reading...

Two independent real-estate experts were cited in the reports.

Continue reading...
items.content: After a connection to ‘trans ideology’ was retracted, suspect’s background and politics are being pored overThough the suspect in the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk was revealed by authorities on Friday, questions surrounding his identity and motivations have exacerbated intense US political debates in the aftermath of the shooting.Authorities revealed Kirk’s suspected killer to be Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old man who grew up in Washington, Utah, along the state’s south-western border. Continue reading...

items.title: Who is the suspect arrested for Charlie Kirk's assassination?
items.standfirst: The family of the young Utah man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk told authorities he had recently become “more political” and recounted a dinner table conversation where they discussed whether the conservative activist was spreading hate. Tyler James Robinson, 22, of Washington, Utah, was arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm causing serious bodily harm, and obstruction of justice, all felonies, according to a probable cause statement filed in court and released Friday. A judge ordered that he be held without bail.
items.content: The family of the young Utah man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk told authorities he had recently become “more political” and recounted a dinner table conversation where they discussed whether the conservative activist was spreading hate. Tyler James Robinson, 22, of Washington, Utah, was arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm causing serious bodily harm, and obstruction of justice, all felonies, according to a probable cause statement filed in court and released Friday. A judge ordered that he be held without bail.

clusters.title: OpenAI and Microsoft reach tentative deal to revise partnership
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI and Microsoft reach tentative deal to revise partnership:

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft reach tentative deal to revise partnership
OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms
items.standfirst: Companies work to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues for-profit restructuring.
items.content: On Thursday, OpenAI and Microsoft announced they have signed a non-binding agreement to revise their partnership, marking the latest development in a relationship that has grown increasingly complex as both companies compete for customers in the AI market and seek new partnerships for growing infrastructure needs. "Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership," the companies wrote in a joint statement. "We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety." The announcement comes as OpenAI seeks to restructure from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, a transition that requires Microsoft's approval, as the company is OpenAI's largest investor, with more than $13 billion committed since 2019.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: OpenAI and Microsoft are working to finalize terms of a revised partnership.
The companies have signed a preliminary agreement.
OpenAI is pursuing a for-profit restructuring.
The deal is tentative, suggesting ongoing negotiations.
The partnership revision is a significant development.
